cc.text: Slots and holes
EasyEDA allows for cutout of circular holes without plating. It simply creates a “Gerber_drill_NPTH.DRL” file with a large diameter drill.
It also allows for slots in the “Gerber_drill_PTH.DRL” file:

;PTH Drill file created by EasyEDA 
M48
INCH,LZ
;Holesize 1 = 0.024 INCH
T01C0.024
%
G05
G90
T01
X006750Y000920G85X006890Y000920
M30
The “G85” command means to make a slot.
Lastly, it allows for circular portions in board outline. It does not make a full circle in one command, rather it creates a pair of semicircles:
Notice how it spells “G2” rather than “G02” and how it repeats the “G01” several times. That may be why JLCPCB didn’t understand my files; I did not do that.
Yes, that fixes my issue:
So I do not need to do linear interpolation after all.

So my next question is: Should I implement round boards, nonplated holes, and slots? I almost need to in order to nicely make Erin Koch’s board… Right now, my board outline is a simple rectangle. I could create a GUI to change its shape, but I am not really sure what I want. I guess the nicest thing would be to be able to drag points around as for filled planes, with an additional option to turn a segment circular. When a circular segment is bordered by two linear segments, it is trivially easy to figure out the radius and center simply from continuity requirements. In fact, that’s not true. This problem is overconstrained. In that case, the segment would automatically be rendered as a circular arc and a straight bit:
Black are preexisting straight segments, the blue segment is being replaced by a curve, resulting in the two red parts.

But if I don’t have any straight parts, it is not obvious what should happen: If I drag the points 1 and 2 together and also the points 3 and 4, I guess a simple circle would result as the simplest solution. But I think I’d rather define a circular board like this:

Can I do that? I think I have two challenges: (1) Given two linear segments and n intermediate points, can I derive arcs to connect the segments through those points? (2) Given just n points, can I derive arcs to connect those points?
Of course, a reasonable alternative—for now at least—would be to simply define a circular outline as a top-level option.
Right now, a board is defined like this:
<board w="584200" h="406400" grid="6350" metric="0" planesvis="0" layer1vis="1" layer2vis="1" layer3vis="1" schem="/home/wagenaar/Desktop/led.schem"/>

Apart from the fact that the “layervis” and “planesvis” flags really don’t belong here, and neither does the “schem”, this is simple enough. In fact, I think I should break up the <board> into <board>, <options>, and <schem> sections, with <board> containing just “w” and “h”, <options> containing the “xxvis” flags and the “grid” and “metric” options, and <schem> containing “link=’…’”. Then it would be easier to replace the inside of <board> with “shape=’rect’ w=… h=…” or “shape=’circ’ d=…”, or “shape=’poly’”, with contents like
<start x=… y=…/><line x=… y=…/><arc x=…y=…/>
and a final <line> or <arc> without coords to go back to start.

Actually, Board contains the options and the linkedschematic at C-level, so it would be better to keep the <board> tag at toplevel and create new <outline>, <options>, and <links> subtags. (I rather like <links schem=”…”/>.)
EasyEDA does not allow arbitrary shapes for holes, only circles. It does allow pads that are oval or polygonal, but I think I don’t need that right now.
One potentially useful thing that is has is arbitrary rotations. Right now, I have rotations in steps of 90°, and no rotation at group level:

That’s the blurb for a resistor. Given that state of affairs, it would be easy enough to add a “arbitrary rotation” option in the Edit menu, which would rotate around the CM of the holes. Text would rotate to the nearest 90°, but that’s OK.
Creating a hole without copper would require a fresh mode icon. Perhaps a black circle with a little ⨯ in it? Like this unicode symbol:
(Not defined in my font, it seems like.)
I want the Text and Arc mode icons to be yellow, I think.
I will need a new icon for editing board outline. It would work just like editing FPs, except that double-clicking on an edge would convert it from straight to arc and v.v.
I should probably replace the ori property on text with simple rot and flip properties. Flip would be omitted unless flip=”1”, and rot would be specified in degrees.

There should also be a rot property on holes and pads, but for now they will be left out. They are necessary for proper arbitrary rotation. Arbitrarily rotated pads would be written to Gerber as G36/G37 regions. At least, that is what EasyEDA does.
Slots should probably be incorporated into the Hole mode. Currently, a hole looks like this in xml:

That should be augmented with optional length and rot properties. In the UI, a new line below ⌀ would be required, and I’d enable the orientation buttons. There is no obvious unicode symbol for it, but I would expect it to look something like ⊂⇤⇥⊃
